login.userNameRegTips: The user name can contain only letters or Numbers(3~32 characters), underscores
login.passwordDiff: Two different input password, please re-entry
login.noLogin: You have not been sign in

error.-3: The number of tars environments exceeds the limit. Please contact the admin if necessary!
error.-4: Failed to load tars environment information
error.-7: There is no available network segment in the system. Please contact the admin!
error.-9: There is no connected network in tars environment
error.-10: Please connect the previously applied tars environment

alloc.info: New allocate network(One network segment supports 253 node servers)?
alloc.apply: Please connect all networks first, and then allocate new network!

release.info: Release the allocated network segment? After release, the network segment node service will not be able to connect to the tars framework!

list.openOuter: Open tars web from Internet network access?
list.closeOuter: Close tars web from Internet network access?

installTarsNode.title: Install TarsNode
installTarsNode.step2Info: Install nodes online on tars web platform or run on server (CentOS):
installTarsNode.step3Info: Complete the monitoring of tarsnode and configure in crontab:

install.outerInfo: You can turn off the external network access, so that after the network is connected, you can access the tars-web through the intranet
install.nameRegTips: The length of TARS name must > 1 and < 20
install.installTars: Installing TARS, please wait, about 30 seconds
install.waitWebSucc: Install TARS succ, waiting for start, about 20 seconds
install.noEnoughResource: Sorry, NO enough resource, can not create TARS

uninstall.confirmUninstallDesc: Please input TARS name, confirm uninstall! After uninstall, cannot recover!!

network.title: Two Step: Connect Your CVM to TARS
network.createNetworkDesc: Notice: Please config network and CVM in region above
network.applyPeerDesc: Notice: Please apply peer network connect

helper.createNetworkHelper: Please config your network to ${network} in ${region}
helper.createPeerHelper: Apply peer network connect, you will use parameter: [ name: ${name}, region: ${region}, account: ${account}, VPCID: ${vpcid} ]
